description: Whether it's a large backyard, a small balcony, or a sunny windowsill, gardening can be a rewarding hobby that adds beauty and life to your home.
sentences: Start small with a few easy-to-care-for plants.
Understand the sunlight requirements for the plants you choose.
Proper watering is key; overwatering is a common mistake.
Use good quality potting mix and appropriate sized pots with drainage holes.
Gardening in India requires choosing plants that can handle the local climate.
dos: Talk to your local nursery (mali) for advice on what grows well in your area.
Learn to identify common pests and how to treat them.
Fertilize your plants according to their needs.
Rotate your indoor plants so all sides get some light.
donts: Don't drown your plants; check the soil moisture before watering.
Don't place sun-loving plants in a dark corner.
Avoid using pots without drainage holes.
Don't give up if a plant dies; it's a learning process.
